title: Coronavirus: Workers describe being hit by job losses and uncertainty
description: Workers lost their jobs face months of uncertainty, as supermarkets embark on a hiring spree.

title: German police arrest man over high-speed rail tampering
description: The 51-year-old is accused of loosening bolts on a railway track just before a bridge outside Frankfurt.

title: Ex-Real Madrid president Sanz dies after contracting coronavirus
description: Former Real Madrid president Lorenzo Sanz dies after being taken to hospital with coronavirus.

title: Maldini and Dybala test positive for coronavirus
description: Juventus and Argentina forward Paulo Dybala and former Italy captain Paolo Maldini test positive for coronavirus.

title: Premier League could resume 'before outbreak ends'
description: Southampton's chief executive suggests Premier League matches could be on television every day while people are still confined to their homes because of the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Coronavirus: First day of UK cafe and pub coronavirus shutdown
description: Britons are spending their weekends away from many public spaces after an instruction from the PM.

title: Coronavirus: Rainbow pictures springing up across the country
description: Children across the UK are painting rainbows to put up in their windows to "spread hope".

title: 'Miracle' as Fatialofa walks 11 weeks after sustaining serious neck injury
description: Worcester lock Michael Fatialofa has walked unaided less than 11 weeks after a serious neck injury left him in intensive care.

title: Supermarkets Tesco, Asda, Aldi and Lidl go on hiring spree
description: Supermarket chains to take on thousands of staff, but Topshop owner Arcadia closes all its stores.

title: Coronavirus: Man proposes in Iceland store
description: He dropped to one knee in the supermarket after an engagement trip to the country was cancelled.

title: Coronavirus: Self-employed need financial help, unions warn
description: A former Conservative cabinet minister joins trade unions in pushing for more financial protection.

title: Liverpool '100% certain' to be champions - data simulations predict rest of season
description: With the 2019-20 football season suspended across Europe, BBC Sport enlists the help of data experts to see how it might pan out.

title: Coronavirus: Portsmouth's James Bolton, Andy Cannon & Sean Raggett test positive
description: Three Portsmouth players, James Bolton, Andy Cannon and Sean Raggett, test positive for coronavirus.

title: Hamilton self-isolating but allays coronavirus concerns
description: F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton allays fans' concerns that he may have coronavirus after he was recently pictured with actor Idris Elba, who has tested positive for the virus.

title: Coronavirus: Hotel made staff homeless in 'admin error'
description: More than a dozen staff at a Highland hotel were sacked and asked to leave staff accommodation.

title: Coronavirus: 'I've lost half of myself' says bereaved husband
description: The husband of a British woman who died in Bali after testing positive for coronavirus speaks to the BBC about her death.

title: 'Decisions have to be made soon' on Tokyo Olympics
description: Nic Coward, the new chairman of UK Athletics, suggests that the Tokyo 2020 Olympics should be postponed because of the coronavirus crisis.

title: Kenny Rogers: Country music legend dies aged 81
description: Known for ballads including The Gambler, Rogers "left an indelible mark" on music, his family says.

title: Coronavirus: Police take action on Bondi Beach crowds
description: Large crowds of people are still flocking to Sydney's beaches despite the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Newspaper headlines: Wage bailout as 'Britain shuts down'
description: The papers focus on the government's shutdown of pubs and restaurants and support for those unable to work.

title: Coronavirus: One in five Americans ordered to stay at home
description: As the US battles the coronavirus outbreak, "non-essential" travel from Canada and Mexico is halted.

title: Coronavirus: Doctors urge conversations about dying
description: Discuss all possible scenarios with loved ones - even uncomfortable ones, palliative care doctors say.

title: Coronavirus: The school of Mum and Dad
description: There are plenty of online resources to help children keep learning while schools are closed.

title: Coronavirus: 'My virtual date sent me £15 for wine'
description: Video chat, drinking games and awkward toilet moments. Virtual dating is here.

title: Coronavirus: Chris Packham on Covid-19's impact on nature
description: Chris Packham says nature can help during self-isolation and considers coronavirus's environmental impact.

title: Coronavirus: The social events you can join from your sofa
description: Meet the people using the internet to keep social gatherings alive during the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Coronavirus: People in Beijing begin to head outdoors
description: The BBC's China correspondent Stephen McDonell met people venturing out for the first time in weeks.

title: Victor Olaiya: Nigeria's 'evil genius' trumpeter who influenced Fela Kuti
description: Nigerian Victor Olaiya, who died last month, was a musical pioneer and mentor to the Afrobeat legend.

title: Coronavirus: Creativity, kindness and canals offer hope amid outbreak
description: From environmental improvements to acts of kindness, there are glimmers of light amid the crisis.

title: Week in Pictures: 14-20 March 2020
description: A gallery of news images taken around the world this week.

title: How Britain’s ‘plague village’ is coming together
description: Eyam in Derbyshire quarantined itself during the plague, how are they dealing with coronavirus?

title: Turning SXSW disappointment into an online opportunity
description: Musicians due to play on the British Embassy stage at SXSW in Texas have been offered a platform of a different kind.
